content.description: <math alttext="A g I solid is in equilibrium with A g with a positive one 1 charge aqueous plus I with a negative 1 charge aqueous; K sub s p is equal to 8.3 times 10 to the negative 17 power at 298 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgI(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="1.0em"></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>8.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>at</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>298</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The dissolution of <math alttext="A g I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented above. Which of the following shows the mathematical relationship between the molar solubility, <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the <math alttext="K sub s p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="A g I" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>AgI</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> at <math alttext="298 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="S equals 8.3 times 10 to the negative 17 power mole per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S equals the fraction 8.3 times 10 to the negative 17 power over 2 mole per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>8.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext>mol/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S equals the square root of 8.3 times 10 to the negative 17 power mole per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>8.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol/L</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S equals 2 times the square root of 8.3 times 10 to the negative 17 power mole per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>8.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="S equals the square root of 8.3 times 10 to the negative 17 power mole per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>8.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol/L</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
